params.pids: Pool IDs of all to be updated. Make sure to update all active pools.

params._reactPerSecond: The amount of React to be distributed per second.

totalAllocPoint.details: Total allocation points. Must be the sum of all allocation points in all pools.

add(uint256,address,address).notice: Add a new LP to the pool. Can only be called by the owner. DO NOT add the same LP token more than once. Rewards will be messed up if you do.

deposit(uint256,uint256,address).notice: Deposit LP tokens to RMV2 for REACT allocation.

emergencyWithdraw(uint256,address).notice: Withdraw without caring about rewards. EMERGENCY ONLY.

harvest(uint256,address).notice: Harvest proceeds for transaction sender to `to`.

lpToken(uint256).notice: Address of the LP token for each RMV2 pool.

massUpdatePools(uint256[]).notice: Update reward variables for all pools. Be careful of gas spending!

migrate(uint256).notice: Migrate LP token to another LP contract through the `migrator` contract.

pendingReact(uint256,address).notice: View function to see pending REACT on frontend.

poolLength().notice: Returns the number of RMV2 pools.

rewarder(uint256).notice: Address of each `IRewarder` contract in RMV2.

set(uint256,uint256,address,bool).notice: Update the given pool's REACT allocation point and `IRewarder` contract. Can only be called by the owner.

setMigrator(address).notice: Set the `migrator` contract. Can only be called by the owner.

setReactPerSecond(uint256).notice: Sets the react per second to be distributed. Can only be called by the owner.

updatePool(uint256).notice: Update reward variables of the given pool.

userInfo(uint256,address).notice: Info of each user that stakes LP tokens.

withdrawAndHarvest(uint256,uint256,addre.notice: Withdraw LP tokens from RMV2 and harvest proceeds for transaction sender to `to`.

userdoc.notice: The (older) ReactMaster contract gives out a constant number of REACT tokens per block. It is the only address with minting rights for REACT. The idea for this ReactMaster V2 (RMV2) contract is therefore to be the owner of a dummy token that is deposited into the ReactMaster V1 (MCV1) contract. The allocation point for this pool on MCV1 is the total allocation point for all pools that receive double incentives.
